text: Yā kāci saññā pe ye keci saṅkhārā atītānāgatapaccuppannā ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā pe ye dūre santike vā sabbe saṅkhārā netaṃ mama nesohamasmi na meso attā ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ
edit: Yā kāci saññā pe ye keci saṅkhārā atītānāgatapaccuppannā ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā pe ye dūre santike vā sabbe saṅkhārā – netaṃ mama nesohamasmi na meso attā ti evametaṃ yathābhūtaṃ sammappaññāya daṭṭhabbaṃ

translations.transtext: Which any perception ... Which any mental fomations, in the past, future or present, internal or external, coarse or subtle, low or excellent, which [is] far or near, all that form should be seen with right knowledge as they really are thus, "This is not mine. I am not this. This is not my self."
